newsitem.title: USA: Ross Stores sees record earnings in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Ross Stores sees record earnings in Q1.

text.p: Ross Stores Inc on Thursday said it expects to report record earnings per share from $0.45 to $0.47 for its fiscal first quarter ended May 3, up as much as 74 percent from the year ago's $0.27 per share.
In a statement, Chief Executive Officer Michael Balmuth said the record earnings were due to better than expected revenue growth for the quarter along with favorable gross margin and expense trends.
"The strong sales momentum in the first quarter this year was broad-based throughout most geographic regions and merchandise categories," Balmuth said.
Ross expects to report first quarter results on May 20.
Ross operates a national chain of off-price retail stores with branded apparel and apparel-related merchandise. It had 315 stores at May 3 versus 296 stores at the end of the same period last year.
